Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 9

Intermediate

Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 9

Continue developing your intermediate vocabulary with these important words used in academic and professional contexts.

Navigation

This is page 9 of 15. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

Economy

/ɪˈkɑːnəmi/

noun

The wealth and resources of a country or region in terms of the production and consumption of goods and services.

"The country's economy has grown significantly in recent years."

Synonyms: financial system, market, commerce

Category: Economics

Education

/ˌedʒuˈkeɪʃən/

noun

The process of receiving or giving systematic instruction.

"She believes that education is the key to success."

Synonyms: learning, schooling, instruction

Category: Learning

Effective

/ɪˈfektɪv/

adjective

Successful in producing a desired or intended result.

"The new teaching method proved to be very effective."

Synonyms: successful, efficient, productive

Category: Success

Element

/ˈeləmənt/

noun

A part or aspect of something abstract; a basic constituent part.

"Trust is an essential element of any good relationship."

Synonyms: component, part, aspect

Category: Components

Emergency

/ɪˈmɜːrdʒənsi/

noun

A serious, unexpected, and often dangerous situation requiring immediate action.

"In case of emergency, please call the number on the wall."

Synonyms: crisis, urgent situation, catastrophe

Category: Crisis

Emphasis

/ˈemfəsɪs/

noun

Special importance, value, or prominence given to something.

"The teacher placed emphasis on the importance of practice."

Synonyms: stress, importance, focus

Category: Importance

Employment

/ɪmˈplɔɪmənt/

noun

The condition of having paid work; the action of giving work to someone.

"The unemployment rate has decreased, meaning more employment opportunities."

Synonyms: work, job, occupation

Category: Work

Environment

/ɪnˈvaɪrənmənt/

noun

The surroundings or conditions in which a person, animal, or plant lives or operates.

"We must protect the environment for future generations."

Synonyms: surroundings, habitat, ecosystem

Category: Nature

Equipment

/ɪˈkwɪpmənt/

noun

The necessary items for a particular purpose; tools or machinery needed for an activity.

"The laboratory has modern equipment for conducting experiments."

Synonyms: tools, apparatus, machinery

Category: Tools

Especially

/ɪˈspeʃəli/

adverb

Used to single out one person, thing, or situation over all others.

"I love all seasons, but I especially enjoy autumn."

Synonyms: particularly, specifically, notably

Category: Emphasis

Event

/ɪˈvent/

noun

A thing that happens, especially one of importance.

"The graduation ceremony was a memorable event for all students."

Synonyms: occurrence, happening, occasion

Category: Occurrence

Evidence

/ˈevədəns/

noun

The available body of facts or information indicating whether a belief or proposition is true.

"The scientist presented evidence to support her theory."

Synonyms: proof, confirmation, verification

Category: Proof
